author: TechnicNick
title: Elegance With Basic Bricks
review:
As the first of the static model, 'hobby' sets, this sweet little car showed that ordinary Lego pieces could make something nice, at a time when it was still regarded very much as just a toy.

All the sets in this line are quite rare now; I guess they weren't a huge sales success when new - they were ahead of their time and now they're just the thing to bring an old AFOL out of his dark ages...

Simple to build, but the end result is surprisingly realistic and I love these old spoked wheels. The model lacks playability of course, but it blurs the line between being a toy and a purely artistic object. If you're a vintage car fan, there's pleasure to be had here.

author: Mikemarine
title: Longest owned possession
review: I first bought this set when I was a kid, saved up my pennies for ages, it cost about £1.70. I threw away the box not long after building it. I used to be able to take it apart and put it back without the instructions. It got put away when we moved, and I found it in the attic of my parents house when I moved out. I am now 50 and still have it. It's a great set, I love the shape without the modern special shaped bricks you get now. Although I own 2 of these now, I am looking to convert the newer set to a pick up body with some spare parts I have collected. I am on the hunt for a box. To sum up, a great set that now displays well as a retro sculpture. I often get asked about it.
